details.content: In Olam HaTohu, the sefirot existed in separationâ€”each standing alone, 'one beneath the other.' This led to Shevirat HaKelim. In Tikun, sefirot integrate and include one another.

details.title: Chesed Within Gevurah
details.content: 'One who spares his rod hates his son.' Withholding discipline seems like chesed but is actually a form of hatred! True love requires sometimes saying 'no'â€”this is gevurah within chesed.

blocks.label: The Body Analogy
blocks.english: The Human Body Â· Comprehensive Vitality in the Brain
blocks.tagline: Although the body is divided into distinct limbs, each limb actually contains elements of all the others. The hand has vitality from the foot through the blood vessels, and vice versa. This is why the brain feels the pain of all 248 limbs.

details.title: The Brain Contains All
details.content: The 'comprehensive vitality' (klalit hachayut) resides in the brain. In the brain, all faculties exist in an undifferentiated stateâ€”like Hiyuli. From here they descend to specific limbs.

details.title: The Brain Feels All Pain
details.content: A blow to the hand hurts the hand, but the brain also perceives that pain. Remarkably, sometimes the brain feels greater pain from a blow to a fingernail than to the hand itself!

details.title: Medical Proof
details.content: This is why medical treatments can affect one limb by acting on anotherâ€”through bloodletting in one limb, healing occurs in a different limb. The veins that connect all limbs prove their essential unity.

blocks.title: Why Accept Ahavas Yisrael Before Prayer?
blocks.intro: The Arizal taught: Accept upon yourself the mitzvah of 'Love your fellow as yourself' before prayer, 'for it is a great foundation in serving Hashem.'

items.content: For the soul to truly elevate to its sourceâ€”where all souls exist as oneâ€”it must be complete and healthy. A soul is 'healthy' when it's connected to all other souls.
If a person harbors hatred, he separates from his soul that portion of his fellow that was included in him. This creates a mum (blemish)â€”an incompleteness.
'Anyone who has a blemish shall not approach to offer...' The incomplete soul cannot unite with the Complete Unity. Or Ein Sof 'cannot tolerate' a deficient offering.
Accepting Ahavas Yisrael makes the soul 'whole' and 'unblemished,' enabling it to ascend to its source. 'Be tamim (complete) with Hashem your G-d.'

blocks.title: The Secret of Self-Love â€” Hillel's Teaching
blocks.intro: Why did Hillel phrase this in the negative â€” 'what is hateful to you, don't do' â€” rather than the positive?

items.content: 'A person doesn't see fault in himself.' He knows his flaws intellectually, but they don't 'take up space' emotionally. Why? Because of self-love.
When you love yourself deeply, that love creates a 'covering' (makif) over your faults. The awareness exists, but it doesn't translate into emotional rejection. ××”×‘×” ×ª×›×¡×” ×¢×œ ×›×œ ×¤×©×¢×™×.
When someone else points out your faultâ€”even something you knewâ€”you become angry! Because now the fault is being 'seen' and gaining weight. Love's covering is removed.
'What is hateful to you'â€”the revelation of your faultsâ€”'don't do to your fellow.' Don't look at his faults as significant. Let your love cover them just as your self-love covers your own.

blocks.outro: This doesn't mean ignoring evil! A true friend helps his friend improve. The point is that awareness of faults shouldn't create emotional distance or rejection. Know his faults, help him grow, but let love cover them.

blocks.title: Two Levels of Unity

items.content: Unity in the Source: In the Or Ein Sof, all sefirot/souls exist as a single 'point' without distinctionâ€”like Hiyuli containing everything in potential. This isn't surprising.
Unity After Emergence: After distinct entities emerge, they still integrate with each other through the revelation of their common source. This is the remarkable innovation.

blocks.outro: The source continues to shine into differentiated reality, creating integration within plurality. This is how distinct souls remain interconnected despite their apparent separation in different bodies.

blocks.text: The Three Parables â€” Understanding Soul Connection

items.title: The Brain & the Limbs
items.body: The brain contains the unified source of all vitality. From it, faculties descend to specific limbsâ€”sight to the eye, hearing to the ear. Yet the brain feels all pain, sometimes more intensely for a fingernail than a hand. So too, souls of great tzaddikim (rooted in the 'brain') feel the pain of all Israel.

items.title: The Veins Connecting Limbs
items.body: Each limb contains elements of all others through the blood vessels. The hand has vitality from the foot, and vice versa. This is why treatment to one limb can heal another. Similarly, each soul contains aspects of every other soulâ€”'in you is your friend also.'

items.title: Self-Love Covering Faults
items.body: You know your own weaknesses better than anyoneâ€”yet they don't make you hate yourself. Your self-love creates a 'covering' that prevents intellectual awareness from becoming emotional rejection. Love your fellow the same way: know his faults, help him improve, but don't let them create distance.

items.title: Many Waters Cannot Extinguish
items.body: When a person has deep, essential love for someone, even wrongs don't 'take up space.' They're nullified before the overwhelming love. As the verse says: 'Many waters cannot extinguish the love'â€”even floods of wrongdoing cannot put out the fire of essential love.

blocks.title: The Tanya's Path â€” Body Secondary, Soul Primary
blocks.intro: The Alter Rebbe explains in Tanya (Chapter 32) that making 'the body secondary and the soul primary' is the 'straight and easy path' to fulfilling Ahavas Yisrael.

items.content: When a person's body is 'despised and lowly in his eyes' and his joy is 'only in the soul'â€”he naturally loves every Jew. From the soul's perspective, all are truly brothers.
'All Israel are truly brothers from the root of their souls in Hashem Echadâ€”only the bodies are divided.' When the soul is primary, you see every Jew as your sibling.
In moments of conflict, ask: 'Am I seeing this person as a separate body competing with me, or as a soul interconnected with mine?' This shift transforms relationships.

blocks.outro: Recognize that your unity with fellow Jews isn't just personalâ€”it has cosmic effects. Every act of love and unity creates corresponding unity above. You have the power, through simple Ahavas Yisrael, to bring blessing to all of Israel.
